noun.description: A place in which bacteria have multiplied or may multiply; a focus of infection.
examples: abscesses and scarring were present which would be consistent with an initial nidus of infection in the lung

noun.description: A place or situation in which something develops or is fostered.
examples: many models of society see the main nidus of struggle residing in the sphere of production

origin: Late 17th century (in the former sense place in which an insect deposits its eggs): from Latin, literally nest.
